fdd:FDD.titleName: MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Advanced Simple Profile

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 2: Visual. Advanced Simple Profile (formal name); MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Advanced Simple Profile (common name)
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description:
See also MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. Useful in Internet streaming applications and other low bandwidth applications but can scale to television broadcast quality.The
Advanced Simple Profile permits the use of the following visual object types:
Simple: rectangular video, uses intra (I) and predicted (P) video object planes (VOPs, the MPEG-4 term for frames).
Advanced Simple: rectangular video, enhanced compression, adds bidirectional (B) video object planes (VOPs).
Six compression levels are permitted (0 to 5); Levels 0 to 3 have bit rates from 128 to 768 kbps; support for interlaced coding is added for Levels 4 and 5 with bit rates from 3 to 8 Mbps.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Video encoding in MPEG-4 Visual family. Is useful in Internet streaming applications and other low bandwidth applications but can also scale to television broadcast quality.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with Visual Coding (All Profiles)

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Actual adoption not known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. Other profiles will produce greater clarity than the Simple Scalable Profile at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_V bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2, use mp42. See Part 15 of the standard, pp. 2-9, 13.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicators for Advanced Simple Profile, levels 0 through 5 are 11110000, 11110001, 11110010, 11110011, 11110100, 11110101, respectively. From Annex G of ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004, Table G.1.

fdd:notes.fdd:general: Fernando Pereira and Touradj Ebrahimi report on page 598 of The MPEG-4 Book that the Advanced Simple Profile "represents a compromise between the desire to support interlace at higher bit rates and the desire to keep the number of profiles manageable. . . . It is likely that another level, termed 3b, will be added . . . [which] will allow higher bit rates without having to support interlaced coding."
